noun.description: A state formally cooperating with another for a military or other purpose.

verb.description: Combine or unite a resource or commodity with (another) for mutual benefit.
examples: he allied his racing experience with his father's business acumen

origin: Middle English (as a verb): from Old French alier, from Latin alligare bind together, from ad- to + ligare to bind; the noun is partly via Old French alie allied. Compare with alloy.
